channel.title: Huge FPS drop at the end of Apprehension
channel.description:
Just droping this by cause I'm still playing. :slight_smile:
In last Apprehension level (the one where we fight Black Ops), right after I killed everyone, switched the lever to open the door, and quick saved the game, the fps dropped down very weirdly. I have quite descent PC, and had no problems through my gameplay with performance whatsoever (I don't see the fps count but it runs very smoothly). Right after that quick save, frames dropped to - I don't know, like - 5 to 10? When I turn around and face the 'rest' of the level (the side where the knockout sequence happen), everything runs normal again. But looking around at the whole chopper hangar causes mentioned problem.
I will see if this happens on my second playthrough. Just wanted you guys to know.

item.title: Huge FPS drop at the end of Apprehension
item.dc:creator: Lewk
item.description:
I too am having huge fps drops in apprehension. As soon as the elevator reaches the top where the security guard gets shot by an assassin, my fps drops from 120 to 27. Then when I enter the large room looking at the helipads and the sky it drops down to 8 fps. When I walk into the room behind it goes back up to 120.

Reloading the level doesn’t help. Starting from the previous level where I have a savegame and working back into the area doesn’t fix it either. I’m stuck, because it’s unplayable at 8 fps and I can’t kill the assassins. I don’t have enough health to get into the back room and have the assassins follow me and kill them.

My rig is: i7, 8 gig ram, gtx480 (with latest 306.23 drivers)

EDIT: I fixed it by restarting Apprehension via the New Game Chapter select screen. Had to do the whole chapter again, but at least it fixed the fps drop.

item.title: Huge FPS drop at the end of Apprehension
item.dc:creator: Mr_Freeman
item.description:
Okay, I was able to easily replicate it again. Killed an assassin, ran up to the lever, switched it, quick saved, quick loaded. Then bam, massive framerate drop.

Here is a screenshot with the showbudget panel.

Note: After that quick load, it mostly fluctuates between 6-10 fps. I took that within milliseconds of quick loading so it was even worse.

EDIT: Here is the quick save, if that helps at all. Every time I load that quick save, the framerate drop is still present. Not sure if it will be for others.
